IncidentAddress.IncAddrComment: W SALISBURY PKWY/ LEMMON HILL LN

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Incident:Vehicle Pursuit / Resist Arrest / DUI Defendant:Damien Jackson (B/M 3/3/1983) Location:Isabella St at Lake St Salisbury MD 21801 Date:1/31/2023 Time:2351 hours Body Camera:https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=a4a98187b9554aaab96e3f4c10af1372partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Dash Camera: https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=1c08a54ab14945348ae11993b2747391partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Property: The below property was seized and placed on property record P-338560. The property was stored in the CDS locker located at the MSP Salisbury barrack. P-338560: -Plastic bag containing marijuana. Weight: 1.2 grams Narrative: On 1/31/23 at approximately 2351 hours, I TFC Eckrich, was on routine patrol in the area of Isabella St and Lake St Salisbury MD. At that time I was behind a red Mazda bearing Maryland registration 7CS2142 at the red light located at that intersection. I observed the vehicle was completely past the clearly marked white stop line at the intersection. The light turned green and the vehicle made a left turn on to Lake St. I observed the vehicles left side tires completely over the solid double yellow center line. The vehicle was more than a half car width over the center line while continuing on Lake St for approximately 10 seconds. I activated my emergency equipment to initiate a traffic stop in the area of Lake St and Burton St. The vehicle continued on Lake St towards U.S. Rt 50, crossing the center line a second time. The vehicle approached the red light at Lake St and U.S. Rt 50 and came to a stop. I exited my patrol vehicle to approach when the light turned green and the vehicle accelerated turning left onto U.S. Rt 50.I got back in my patrol vehicle and began to pursue. I activated my siren multiple times in an attempt to get the vehicle to stop. I advised the MSP Salisbury barrack that the vehicle had continued. The vehicle then turned right on to Mill St while the traffic control signal was red. The vehicle did not stop prior to making a right turn on red, and disobeyed the traffic control device stating no right turns on red. The vehicle then turned left on to Main St. I continued to activate my siren in an attempt to get the vehicle to stop. The vehicle then made a left turn on to Saint Peters St. The vehicle then failed to stop at the clearly marked stop sign before making a right turn on to W. Church St. The vehicle came to a stop in front of 110 W Church St. The driver opened his door, and I exited my patrol vehicle. I drew my weapon and started giving law orders for suspect to show me his hands. I observed the driver stumble, and I could not see his hands at the time. The suspect then began to run from me, crossing U.S Rt 50 towards Lemon Hill Ln. I holstered my weapon and began to pursue the suspect. I chased the suspect across U.S. Rt 50, where I caught him in the area of U.S. Rt 50 and Lemon Hill Ln. I immediately rolled the suspect on to his stomach and began giving verbal commands to place his hands back behind his back. While rolling the suspect over, I observed a small abrasion to the right side of his face. The suspect began to actively resist arrest by placing his arms underneath his stomach and failing to obey my commands to place his hands behind his back. While I was utilizing a muscling technique to get his hands behind his back, I detected the strong odor of alcoholic beverage coming from his breath and person. I also noticed his eyes appeared to be glassy and bloodshot. Eventually with the help of an assisting Trooper, we were able to get the suspects hands behind his back and into handcuffs. The suspects Colorado identification card was located in the red Mazda. The suspect was positively identified as DAMIEN RICHARD JACKSON (B/M 3/3/93). Jackson did admit to consuming alcoholic beverages earlier in the night. Located on the drivers side floor of the vehicle was a plastic baggie containing marijuana. I identified the substance as marijuana a schedule I controlled dangerous substance. A passenger that was inside the vehicle during the pursuit was identified as Jamie Washington (W/F 12/11/87).Washington advised that she knew Jackson was intoxicated during the pursuit. At 2354 hours, I placed Jackson in custody. I was advised by MSP Salisbury that Jackson had an active warrant through Worcester County for his arrest. I initially placed Jackson in the front passenger seat of my patrol vehicle, and seat belted Jackson. While I was conducting a search of the red Mazda, Jackson took off his seat belt and attempted to get out of my patrol car. TFC Hopkins had to hold Jackson in the seat to prevent him from exiting the vehicle. Due to Jackson becoming increasingly irate, and attempting to get out of my vehicle, I requested a caged vehicle for transport. Salisbury Police Department responded with a caged vehicle, and I walked Jackson over to the police car. Jackson refused to sit in the Salisbury Police Car, and ignored mutlipel verbal commands to sit down in the vehicle. I eventually had to use a muscling technique to push Jacksons upper body into the car, while assisting officers pushed Jacksons lower body into the seat. Jackson then stuck his right leg out of the door to prevent us from closing the door. I pushed Jacksons right leg in the vehicle and was eventually able to successfully shut the door. Jackson was transported to MSP Salisbury barrack for processing. At the barrack, I asked Jackson if he wanted to submit to Standardized Field Sobriety Tests. Jackson refused to submit to SFSTs. I then read the DR-15 advice of rights to Jackson. Jackson refused to submit to the intoximeter test. Jackson also refused to sign the DR-15 and the DR-15a. Sgt Pardoe of the Maryland State Police verified the seized marijuana to have a weight of 1.2 grams. Jackson was transported to the Wicomico County Detention Center All events occurred in Wicomico County Maryland.

Incident:DUI, Bailout, Use of Force Suspect:Damien Richard Jackson (3/3/1983) Body Camera Link:34fe803986ac4984a1ff89ebc4b04486partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Dash Camera Link:48c950b55ce94f18aa3285290cbcae3epartner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 On 01/31/2023 at approximately 2351 Hours , I Cpl. Bean responded towards the area of 50 @ Mills St. to assist with a vehicle that Tfc. Eckrich was attempting to stop a vehicle. TFC Eckrich advised the vehicle made several turns before turning onto W.Church st where the driver an unknown black male subject stopped jumped from the vehicle and ran on foot . The Unbeknown driver ran across Rt.50 business before being apprehended by TFC. Eckrich at Rt.50 Business and Lemmon Hill. I pulled onto W Church st from N Division st when I observed the unbeknown black male driver flee from the vehicle. I stayed with the suspect vehicle and observed a passenger in the vehicle. I contacted the passenger of the vehicle who was identified by her Maryland license as Jamie Anne Washington. The Unbeknown drivers Colorado ID was located in the vehicle on the dash where he was identified as Damian Richard Jackson. I requested a tow truck due to the driver and passenger being intoxicated.I remained with the vehicle and that passenger securing the scene while the vehicle was searched and eventually removed from the scene by Puseys towing.

This incident was captured on BWC. BWC appeared to be working properly. https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=60c0f0cb77f34f8e8868610c8dfb0536partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 NARRATIVE: On January 31st, 2023 at approximately 2353 hours, I, TFC. Hopkins #7202 responded to W. Church Street and N. Division Street to assist TFC. Eckrich #7047 with an unknown subject who bailed out of the vehicle and ran on foot. Upon my arrival, I observed TFC. Eckrich and TFC. Huntington #6843 walking across eastbound Route 50 prior to N. Division Street with and unknown black male, later identified as, Damien Jackson (B/M 03/03/1983), handcuffed. After Jackson was escorted to TFC. Eckrichs patrol vehicle, I assisted TFC. Eckrich as he searched Jacksons person. I assisted TFC. Eckrich as Jackson was placed in the front passenger car of TFC. Eckrichs patrol vehicle and seat belted per MSP policy. While standing near the front passenger side door of the patrol vehicle, I observed Jackson making unusual movements as if he were trying to unbuckle his seat belt with his left hand. I advised, Jackson to stop moving, sit back, and not to unbuckle his seat belt. At approximately 0005 hours, on February 1st, 2023, I requested Salisbury Police Department (SPD) to respond to our location with a caged police car, due to Jacksons behavior and Jackson unbuckling his seat belt while handcuffed. While waiting for SPD to arrive, Jackson attempted to exit the passenger seat and exit the patrol vehicle several times after being told to remain seated. I extended my right arm and placed my hand on Jacksons left shoulder to prevent Jackson from exiting the vehicle. On February 1st, 2023 at 0012 hours, SPD officer, PFC Larkin #1141 arrived on scene. Myself and TFC. Eckrich escorted Jackson to SPD patrol vehicle and ordered Jackson to get into the vehicle. Jackson refused to get into the vehicle, as he continued to yell and curse. It should be noted, while attempting to place Jackson in the vehicle, Jackson would keep both legs extended outside the car door, making it difficult for TFC. Eckrich, and PFC Larkin to place Jackson in the vehicle which took approximately two (2) minutes long. I escorted SPD back to the Salisbury barrack, where Jackson was placed in ankle shackles before exiting SPD vehicle. Due to Jacksons behavior, he was escorted by myself and PFC Larkin to the holding cell. There a secondary search was conducted and handcuffs were removed from the back and placed in front due to his behavior. All events occurred in Wicomico County, Maryland.

Maryland State Police Salisbury Barrack E Incident: DUI, Bailout, Use of Force Suspect: Damien Richard Jackson (3/3/1983) Body Camera Link:https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=6daf2fe296a44fe6ae0c6d4c284338c3partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Dash Camera Link:https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=5e6e30e6ac374543a2d58a7b7ab990a5partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1 Narrative On 1/31/23 at approximately 2353 hours, I TFC Huntington of the Maryland State Police Salisbury Barrack responded to the area of Route 50 and Lemmon Hill Lane Salisbury Wicomico County, Maryland to assist TFC Eckrich with a subject that had bailed out of a vehicle. When I arrived to TFC Eckrichs location, the subject, later identified as Damien Richard Jackson, was on the ground at the corner of Route 50 and Lemmon Hill Lane on the sidewalk. I conducted muscling techniques to assist with getting Jackson into handcuffs. I took hold of Jacksons right arm and wrist, and muscled it out from under Jacksons torso. I was able to get his arm out from under his torso and get it to his back to get cuffs on. After handcuffs were applied, I stopped any use of force. After Jackson was in handcuffs, I observed an abrasion on the right side of his forehead. I later observed abrasions on both of my hands and right knee from getting Jackson into handcuffs. Medical treatment was not required for neither Jackson nor myself. All events occurred in Wicomico County Maryland.
